wikipedia_page.main: Teresa Mary Tennant  (née Cormack; 29 May 1959 – 7 July 2018) was a British advocate of sustainable investment. She co-founded one of the UK’s first green investment funds. She was a pioneer in the field of responsible investment and was described by The Economist in its obituary notice as "a giant of green finance."

response: ** Tessa Tennant, English green investment campaigner (died 2018)
The board of non-executive trustees was chaired by Tessa Tennant, who also founded The Ice Organisation.
*Tessa Tennant, 59, British green investment campaigner, cancer.Tessa Tennant obituary
